headline: Potato Salad
description: This easy potato salad recipe is made with boiled red potatoes, pickles, hard-cooked eggs, and mayonnaise for a good old-fashioned cookout side dish.

video.description: This old-fashioned potato salad is an easy classic recipe!
video.name: How to Make Potato Salad

name: Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain. Return potatoes to the empty pot to dry and cool.
Stir together mayonnaise, pickles, hard-cooked eggs, red onion, celery, mustard, cider vinegar, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Fold in cooled potatoes until well combined.
Chill potato salad in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours to overnight before serving.

review.reviewBody: Pretty much what I grew up on. Add more eggs or egg yolks. The eggier the better. I use a dozen eggs when I make potatoes salad. I also dont like raw crunchy celery in my food. I use celery seeds Instead . I set out celery stalks, baby carrots, broccoli, mushrooms and dip as an additional appetizer for those that want to snack.
Easy to make . Very tasty
Brilliant!

This is a great base for "Mom's". The potatoes need to cook a lot longer so taste them. From here add all your family faves and be careful not to over dress. Halving the recipe still makes a large bowl. Use as making additives as you like. Delish!

I made this for a summer meal. My 83 year old Mother in Law said that it reminded her of her mothers potato salad. It is delicious and brought back fond memories. If you want traditional Potato Salad, this is it.
Like many others, this was the potato salad of my youth. I think it's the proportion of potato to pickle relish that givens it that flavor. Very easy to make, tasty to eat.

I could not believe how good this potato salad was. While making it I thought it was a bit labor intensive, but it was worth it. Only changes I made were to use onion powder instead of onion, and a pinch of sugar. Will definitely make again.
Amazing! Was surprised with the apple cider vinegar but it was yummy and the family loved it!
I never use pickle in potato salad and I use sweet onion rather than red. tastes great
I must say it's nice to see a potato salad recipe that's savory all the way through instead of mixed with sweet ingredients!

I stayed pretty close for someone who throws stuff together. I did use some homemade stronger mustard for more tang wakeup. I also cut all but the red potatoes in small, flavor popping pieces. Not as much mayo. That would have covered up nice flavors.

My family don’t like a lot of extras in theirs so we just used the Mayo, mustard, pickles and vinegar, salt and pepper, but doing that it was kinda sour so we added 2 tablespoons of white sugar and it was amazing!
Delicious. I felt you could reduce the mayonnaise as it truly was a bit to creamy but still by far delicious
I loved it. Made a couple of adjustments eg cottage cheese, cayenne pepper, spring onions (using what ingredients I had in the fridge/pantry) - it was delicious.

Good base except the first time I made it the pickle flavor was overwhelming. Perhaps it depends on the brand. I made it again and I halved the amount of pickles and increased the amount of celery 3x and we liked that better.

I have made this a lot in the last 6 months. We get together with our kids at the lake, and they always are wanting me to bring the potato salad. I'll make it at home, a day or two before we meet up. That way it's done and I can enjoy my time with them instead of being in the RV cooking. My kids are not fans of real mayo, so I do use miracle whip, and sour pickles. My mother used them in just about everything that called for pickles.
Everyone loved this. Followed the recipe except for adding about 3/4 cup of mustard, and reducing mayo by same amount.
I used the recipe as a guide. I didn't have the exact ingredients. Used Russet potatoes and a white onion, added a bit of sour cream as I didn't have enough mayo. Came out great.

I made this recipe once for a BBQ about five years ago, and now it's what everyone asks me to bring. I've been making it ever since. This is a GREAT potato salad. This is my go-to for every BBQ and now I am known for it.

Great recipe! I followed some of the suggestions on the reviews such as adding some sweet pickle juice. I also used 1 cup less of mayonnaise and it was plenty! I added garlic powder and paprika as well and it was great!
Bland, won't make again
This is so good! I would give it ten stars if I could!
Delicious and the perfect side to our July 4th BBQ! I added chopped red, yellow and green peppers for added crunch and color. I also use smoked paprika. I will definitely make this again.

Baffles me there aren’t more reviews on this. This is the ONLY potato salad, the genuine, an obsession. I follow it as directed. Been making it so much I can almost make it without looking it up. ANY excuse to make it. It’s difficult for me to eat potato salad from anywhere else because I compare it to this. It’s also difficult to restrain myself from sneaking extra bites from it when it’s sitting in the fridge. Do yourself a favor and make this now. You almost have all the ingredients in your house already. Just don’t omit anything. Everything works so well together, from the pickles and mustard to the egg and celery and vinegar. Do it.
This was a hit Memorial Day and was requested again for the 4th!

Really good! I’ve made this twice vegan-style, using veganaise instead of mayonnaise. Once I left out the eggs and the second time I added a little black salt for some egginess, but both times this was excellent so I don’t think the egg is required.

I made it almost exactly as the recipe. i boiled the potatoes in their skins, and chopped them up afterward. I left out the pickles, because not everyone in my family likes them. I added some paprika. It was delicious, and a wonderful addition to our meal. We served it with grilled chicken, mixed green salad, green beans, baked beans, and cheese cake.

This recipe is delicious. It's very close to the recipe I usually use, but I liked this one better.
I do have a question. I adjusted the recipe to 10 servings rather than 20. The site said to add 3c mayo for 20, but only 3.5 tblsp for half the recipe. How can that be?
This was a definite hit!!

This is the best potato salad I've eaten, to date. My family all raved about how good it was. Even though it was very similar to what my mom made while I was growing up, the apple cider vinegar and diced dill pickles truly took it to a new level of good.
Delicious!!
Nice! A really solid recipe!
This came out sooooo good! I cooked the potatoes for around 20 minutes, but maybe could have done for @ 25. My family loved it! Great recipe!
Excellent! I like to use red wine vinegar and pour it over the potatoes first with the salt and let it sit about 20 minutes and then mix in the rest.
So so so good! My neighbor won’t stop asking me to make it! Dare I say it’s better than my mama’s recipe?!!! Well... it is!!
So yummy! Made it gluten free for a family get together. Everyone loved it!

I made a variant of this recipe that turn out quite well. Thanks for the base recipe.
Cheers!

Due to the pandemic, I didn't have eggs, onion, or celery, and this STILL turned out wonderful! I scaled down the recipe to 6 servings, and I used 3 large russet potatoes. The amount of dressing that the 6 servings directions yield was perfect for 3 large russets. In place of the onion, I used onion powder (to taste) and in place of the celery I used celery seed (just a few shakes, because celery seed is potent). If you don't have celery seed, you could totally use celery salt (just reduce or omit the regular salt the recipe calls for). I also added a pinch of sugar per another reviewer, and it gave the potato salad that hint of sweetness that I love. This recipe is a keeper and I can't wait to try it again when I have all of the ingredients on hand. Oh! I also added a few shakes of paprika at the very end, when serving, for a pop of color and another dimension of flavor.

I made four servings. So far so good. It still has to chill. I substituted Italian green olives and red wine vinegar for the relish/pickles and apple cider vinegar. Are used to eggs instead of one because I like them. I also stirred in 1/2 of an avocado roughly chopped. Again because I like?
Added a bit of bacon and some red peppers.
I tried to half the recipe, but I printed the recipe with the full serving size and I put in the wrong ratios. It was still edible, but the pickle and mustard were off.
Made enough to serve 40. Followed the recipe exactly. It was Perfect! The best potato salad I have made.
Was craving a good, simple potato salad and this was perfect. I left out the celery and added crumbled bacon. And mashed the potatoes because it’s just better that way
I added dill and chives and it was fantastic.
easy, very traditional potato salad. a little bland so I used Dijon mustard and a little cayenne pepper. Smoked paprika on the top
I didn't use pickles because I didn't have any. It was delicious!

Turned out really well. I used a little pickle relish and yellow mustard. Made a smaller batch since there are only two os us but we will have some for a couple of days anyway. Also used light mayo and you couldn’t tell the difference. Will make again.
I reduced the servings to four, and there is still plenty. I added a sprinkle of dill weed too.
Easiest potato salad I’ve ever made and everyone loved it!
Delicious and so easy. I made a smaller amount, for 6, and added some fresh cilantro. Everyone enjoyed it!

I have been making various potato salad recipes for years and always add a few scoops of sweet relish. When I came across this recipe I was out of relish so decided to add the chopped dill pickles instead. So glad I did. This is now my one and only potato salad recipe. We both loved it. Good bye relish, hello pickles!

I have made this several times now after finding this recipe last year. My husband and I love it. I have always struggled to make a perfect Potato salad and banana bread. Thank you for this recipe. I now only struggle with banana bread. This recipe has a great balance of ingredients. I’ve made it with red potatoes as well as russet. We actually prefer the russet, but that’s just a personal preference.

It had wonderful flavor but was too much mayonnaise. I like mine a little dryer and when I saw 3 cups, I was worried so I cut it down to 2 cups and it still had too much. Flavor - Great! Next time I will cut the mayo to 1 cup and then adjust to taste. Otherwise try it for yourself!
This is big hit with my friends. I've made it 4 times in two weeks so far. This will be my new Go To when it comes to potato salad.
I agree with Gale recipe needs a little mustard
Very good
Its pretty good, but a bit to much vinegary for my tastes, next time I will cut it back or leave it out. My BF liked it just as it is.

This is the best staple potato salad I've ever come across. Everyone was raving about the perfect balance of ingredients. Only major change I made was 2 cups of light mayo instead of 3, and 1 cup of relish (it would be great with 2 cups of pickles, I just didn't have that much)
delicious

I used dill pickle relish instead of chopping up pickles because didn't have any pickles to chop up. I also put in some dill and paprika and used celery salt instead of regular salt. It was really good
This is the classic potato salad that I know and love from childhood! Can't go wrong with this one.
This was my very first time making potato salad Love this recipe easy to do and tasted great!! I will be making this I’m the future.

Great recipe, much like the old days, and the potato salad my mom used to make. The pickle juice worked beautifully for the vinegar… Naturall. We added capers because hubby is fond of them. no time for hard-boiled eggs, so made it without. Just as good. Used sweet onion instead of red, again, because of supplies. Basically a wonderful recipe!

I loved it only thing is that I would use less mayonnaise next time lots more of celery I use less onions cause I don't like too much uncooked onions, cayenne pepper, sugar this was the first time I ever used celery and apple cider vinegar it was yummy just add my own stuff this just put a twist on it
I have made this many times. We absolutely love it!
I did not add the pickles, mainly because my hubby doesn't like them. I did add some crumbled bacon and that seemed to give a crunch. I would definitely make this again.
This is sooo good! Great recipe!

My wife and I both agree, this is the best Potato Salad we've ever had! Add chopped green onion and paprika like the photo shows, but the recipe omits. Also, instead of 3 cups of mayo, we used 2 cups of mayo and 1 cup of plain Greek yogurt.
Fair to good. Grandma’s recipe was to add soft boiled eggs to make it great

Excellent! I took it to a dinner and received rave reviews from everyone. I did not use all of the dressing. There was more than needed, but I saved it to make more potato salad. Thanks for the recipe!

Very simple and delicious. I liked that I have everything on hand and it's easy to mix around the vegetables. I didn't add pickles as I don't like them but added some green peppers instead. Will make again.
I made this for my Thanksgiving meal and my family loved it! I will definitely make this again and again!

Superb. I don’t really know what made it so good, but it’s so delicious. I chopped the pickles, only had one spear left in the jar, and decided to add it. I added an extra egg because I love finding hard boiled egg chunks in potato salad. I added the mayo and mustard without measuring (3 cups mayo = 24 oz (google conversion) and I had a 30 oz jar). When I finally mixed in the potatoes, I took my first taste. It was too good to mess with further. I’m a fan. It’s chilling in the fridge now.

I chose this recipe for its high ranking & the flavors do not disappoint. I used dill pickles since the recipe does not specify. I followed other reviewers’ suggestions to boil the potatoes longer than 10 minutes, I boiled mine for 20 minutes. I also added green onions for a sprinkle of color. At first, I thought it was too runny, but after sitting in the fridge for an hour, I stirred the mixture again, and the consistency was perfect. I will definitely be making this again!
I substituted the pickles with sweet green relish.

I used a bottle of Vlasic dill pickle relish in place of chopped pickles and apple cider vinegar. Peeled and Cut up one three pound bag of red potatoes. Garnished with paprika and chopped green onions. Turned out great, family loved it.

I added home made seasoned salt to give it a bit more flavor. I used kosher dill pickles., because it wasn't specified. Also, I used salt potatoes and easily removed the thin skins. It came out very go. Thanks allrecipes for helping me make it for 1.

I made this without onion, used horseradish mustard, Russet potatoes, boiled skins on, then cooled, peeled and cubed. Seasoned with Beau Monde and black pepper. Garnished with parsley flakes and paprika.

Tastes good now, but placed in the fridge ... will be very good tomorrow!
No changes made and I will make it again.
Really yummy worked perfect, favorite potato salad recipe

Just right. Not a fan of pickles, so I left them out. Had some frozen peas and added those. Thought I was going to be a bit shy on mayo so after I combined that the Dijon, I mashed an avocado into the mix and that was yummy.
I didn't put pickles in as some family members are not fond of but I did add a chopped apple...all other ingredients were included.. Delicious...will definitely make again.
Replaced pickles with colored peppers

Excellent flavor and texture. I’ve always made potato salad the way my mom did just throwing in the same things she did, which was always good! I just saw this and decided to try it and I’m not sorry! It is excellent. I followed the recipe just as it’s written.
Just added a little pickle juice
Great old fashioned potato salad. Reminds me of picnics when I was a child.
This came out great. I followed the recipe only I cooked the potatoes longer.

I added a couple extra eggs, and used a couple teaspoons of onion powder instead of raw onion so I could make it ahead and not have the onion be overwhelming. Next time I’ll try boiling the potatoes whole and dicing afterwards for slightly more consistent cooking.
No changes, will always make this
Great recipe, easy enough to make.

This was so good! I made it for a company potluck. My first time ever making potato salad. It took way longer to make than the directions stated, but it turned out amazing! Most of the time was spent cutting the potatoes & veggies. My advice is don't be shy with the salt in the water for the potatoes and when they are done and drained add plenty of salt too. I also used garlic aioli mustard which really took this recipe to the next level flavor-wise. This was a HUGE hit at the potluck. I saw people eating it by the plateful LITERALLY.

Having never made potato salad before, I found this recipe to be easy to execute with really good results. I did follow other's suggestions to pare back the amount of mayo to a little bit over 2 cups. I also used my mom's trick of grating the onion which was really easy and quick. I did add about a teaspoon of garlic powder and used Guldens spicy brown mustard instead of yellow mustard. Everyone raved about the potato salad at the BBQ and my mom (who's the best chef I know) requested I make it for her birthday BBQ tomorrow.

Y family loved this recipe. Followed the recipe exactly.
I will be making this one again
I made it with just regular potato (peeled skin) and if I did it again, I would add olives to it. made it for Easter... no left overs made it home. everyone loved it
Very good potato salad. I was Leary about the pickles but they work in the recipe.
I halved the recipe as I am the only one in my family who eats potatosalad. It was delicious and easy. I followed the recipe exactly and it was great. I will make it again.
It was a big hit

First off, the lady that said it was yuck, well, she was partially right. The 1/2 c of vinegar was way to much. I downsized it to 1T. And added a squirt more mustard. Sprinkled w/ bacon and freshly grated cheddar. It's always a request @ my husband's work functions. I think its the cooking process of the dressing that adds distinction to this recipe!
Happy Thanksgiving...good stuff. Needs crispy bacon bits
